result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane M Forseth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Weitzner advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Case called at 10:32 a.m.  Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Shane M Forseth did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court issues a capias - $1,000.00 cash bail set.  Bail is ordered revoked and foreited.
Initial appearance on June 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   
Defendant Shane M Forseth did not appear.   

Atty. Weitzner presented statements to the court.
Defendant is currently in treatment in the State of California (Cross-Roads Treatment Facility).

Last Adjournment Per the Court.

  Initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on May 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Shane M Forseth did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is currently in treatment.  Court adjourns.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Atty. Mark Kershek appointed to represent the defendant.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Shane M Forseth did not appear.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court adjourns the matter for status of treatment.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Two letters from treatment facility advising the Court that the defendant is inpatient in California.

Defendant Shane M Forseth not in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cindy Forseth, mother of Shane Forseth. Defendant is currently in a treatment center. She is waiting for the treatment center to fax her information. Court adjourns initial appearance for verification of the program. State takes no position. Defendant to contact the Public Defender.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
